intro: Oreocharis sinohenryi, commonly known as the Yunnan bellflower, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant is herbaceous, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often clustered at the base. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
